title: SFH on Steering Committee on Review of Hospital Authority
content_text:
p>
	Following is the transcript of remarks made by the Secretary for Food and 
	Health, Dr Ko Wing-man, after attending a public function today (July 20): Secretary for Food and Health: The Steering Committee on Review of Hospital 
	Authority (HA) has just completed its consultation work. We held the third 
	public consultation forum yesterday. In the past few months, we have 
	conducted extensive consultation work by meeting with stakeholders including 
	professional organisations, and patients' groups, as well as paying visits

professional organisations, and patients' groups, as well as paying visits 
	to all the seven hospital clusters under the HA. In addition, we have 
	conducted four rounds of focus group discussion and three public fora. In 
	the coming few months, the steering committee will summarise and examine all 
	opinions received during the consultation period. We hope to come up with 
	our conclusions and recommendations to the HA by the end of this year or 
	early next year. Feedbacks received during the consultation period are in

early next year. Feedbacks received during the consultation period are in 
	two major areas. Firstly is the resources allocation mechanism between the 
	HA headquarters and the seven hospital clusters. There were opinions 
	maintaining that the HA in future should allocate resources according to the 
	population size of the respective clusters. The second area is in human 
	resources management. This is about the efficiency of the HA to allocate or 
	mobilise resources among hospital clusters to meet the extraordinary service 
	demand, as well as to maintain the consistency of the human resources
demand, as well as to maintain the consistency of the human resources policies. (Please also refer to the Chinese portion of the transcript.)
